dashboard.label: Settings
dashboard.description: How to use settings to customize the visualization.

tr.td:
The default thresholds will be used for all rows if you don't specify any thresholds in your search query.
This value controls the background color of the cells, where green indicates that the value is normal, yellow indicates a warning, and red indicates a critical state.
You can set these valuse in the search query by using an eval statement:
...| eval warning_threshold = case(name=="windows_server", 60,name=="unix_server", 65, 1==1, 70)
| eval critical_threshold = case(name=="windows_server", 80,name=="unix_server", 85, 1==1, 90)

td.p:
Fixed size or Auto
This setting determines the number of characters to display.
Fixed Size will limit the length to a value you provide. If you try to display a longer word, it will be cut off, whereas shorter words will show blank panels.
Auto Length will automatically fit the longest term (up to a maximun of 50 characters).

Fixed Size
If you choose Fixed Size above, this value will be used to determine the length within the range of 1 to 50.

Refresh
This setting determines if the Departures Board will cycle through values, or just update once.
True - cycle through all values returned from your search. If your search only returns one value it will still update.
False - Only the first result from your search will be displayed. The animation will only run once.

Refresh every X seconds
If you chose to refresh, this setting determines how often the update will occur, in seconds.

tr.td: Colours allows you to choose the colour scheme for the values (cell background colours).

Downtime Range lets you indicate when there is regular scheduled downtime for your environment. Use 24 hour format: 0 = Midnight, 12 = Midday, 22 = 10 PM.
Downtime is indicated by showing a grayed out cell. You can still see the value and status, however the downtime indication lets you know that downtime was in effect.
